intro: Maerua mucronata, commonly known as the African sandmat, is a shrub native to arid and semi-arid regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Capparaceae and is characterized by its woody stems and small, fleshy leaves. The plant produces yellow flowers followed by small, round fruits that contain seeds. It is adapted to survive in harsh, dry environments with minimal water. Its root system helps stabilize soil and prevent erosion in sandy soils.
